Dialogue: That's right. Just let it go.       Let it go.

Speaker: sierra
Dialogue: You did it to yourself.   Admitting that is the first step.

Speaker: octavia
Dialogue: Because you forgot who you were.

Speaker: agitated man
Dialogue: You can't describe it with human words.

Speaker: octavia
Dialogue: You can't think it with human thoughts.

Speaker: margaret
Dialogue: You could destroy the world with a single thought.  Don't, incidentally. Just file that away. But the truth is, you hold all the cards: every church, every candle, every sacrifice -- that's for you. When people pray, they're not praying because they want this thing or that thing. They just don't want to be forgotten.

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: Maybe if I just cut back, didn't get so involved...

Speaker: sierra
Dialogue: We both know that'll never work. Next week, you'll be back here redesigning the pinecones. You have to quit cold-turkey.

Speaker: sierra
Dialogue: You can. But I can't force you to leave. You have to want it.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You need to go, don't you?

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: How long? Forever? Every day, you'd know what you were missing.

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: Worst-case scenario? Spontaneous disintegration into a fiery void. Oblivio accebit. The end of everything.

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: That probably wouldn't happen. The basic structure of the universe should hold. I guess I'm just worried about the human factor. You guys kill each other a lot.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: In fairness, that's usually in your name. Plus we've gotten much more efficient at it.

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: I like this world. I like my life, here, with you and Noelle...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: But it's not real. I'm not really your wife, you're not really my husband. On some level, it's all pretend.

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: It's not pretend. There's a reason you were there, in every version. You were my sister, my wife, my best friend...

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: I wanted you close. In one version, I even told you. I warned you that some day they might come for me, and...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: ...You'd have to leave.   How many versions were there?

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: Ninety.   This is the last one.

Speaker: gabriel
Dialogue: I've destroyed billions of people with a thought. Obliterated them. And you'd like to think it's painless...

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Stop. You don't have to explain, or apologize. Everything that is, is because of you. If that's all, that's enough.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Guess you don't really need to pack anything.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: You're great. It's been a pleasure.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Love you, too. Ya big lug.

Speaker: noelle
Dialogue: And if I had another horse...

Speaker: noelle
Dialogue: He's not coming back. But it's gonna be okay. He put the pieces together, it's like...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Honey? Is it supposed to stick like this?

Speaker: additional material
Dialogue: The following scene  is the conversation between S and G that plays near the end of Part Three. The plan is to shoot this scene in almost every setup of the film that involves both characters -- be it in Part One, Two or Three.  So we'll be shooting this scene a lot. We'll then be intercutting the best of all these moments to create one sequence.
